result.execSummary:
All charges against Travis Adam Bates in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travis Adam Bates is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**AMENDMENT 3/16/2022 - ADDITIONAL NO CONTACT WITH D.W.R. (dob 6-21-2000), OR J.W.B. (dob 10-4-1999) OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL.**

*AMENDMENT 3/9/2022 - ADDITIONAL NO CONTACT WITH K.G.R. (dob 6-3-2000), D.W.R. (dob 6-21-2000), OR J.B.W. (dob 10-4-1999) OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL. 

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.J.K. (dob 2-16-2000) OR K.G.R. (dob 6-3-2000) OR THEIR RESIDENCES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
